content.description: The illustration shows the active transport of hydrogen ions through a membrane protein.
content.question: Which of the following best predicts the effect of not having <math alttext="A T P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> available to supply energy to this process?

choices.label: <math alttext="H plus" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>+</mtext></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ions will stop moving through the protein.

<math alttext="H plus" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>+</mtext></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ions will move in the other direction through the protein.

<math alttext="H plus" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>+</mtext></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ions will continue to move through the protein in the original direction but at a slower rate.

<math alttext="H plus" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>+</mtext></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ions will begin to move through the phospholipid portion of the membrane in the original direction.

content.answer: <math alttext="H plus" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>+</mtext></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ions will stop moving through the protein.

skill.text: 6.E: Predict the causes or effects of a change in, or disruption to, one or more components in a biological system.
